meanings.definition: To change the structure or form of (something)
meanings.sent1: She remodelled her room by moving the furniture around.
meanings.sent2: The company remodelled its logo to attract younger customers.
meanings.sent3: The cat remodelled the yarn into a tangled mess.
meanings.sent4: His words remodelled her perspective on life.
meanings.sent5: The artist remodelled the clay into a beautiful sculpture.

meanings.definition: To give a new shape or form to (something)
meanings.sent1: He remodelled the old car into a sleek, modern vehicle.
meanings.sent2: The chef remodelled the traditional dish with a unique twist.
meanings.sent3: The kids remodelled the sandcastle into a fortress fit for a king.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter remodelled the somber atmosphere into one of joy.
meanings.sent5: The storm remodelled the landscape, leaving behind a new scenery.
